intro: Racosperma genistifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wattle, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, yellow pea-like flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas. Racosperma genistifolium is a hardy, low-maintenance plant that is well-suited for cultivation in arid and semi-arid regions.
